issue.title: [CF 857] Event Setting options disabled? (greyed out)
issue.body:
Since updating to 6.2.5, I've had the issue with animations never turning off.
The desired behaviour is that, when the duration of the buff ("Inquisition") is below 5 seconds, the icon border activates. When the buff is refreshed, this should stop.  Prior to this, I had made this work by using "Event Settings" to "only handle if condition is passing "Duration < 5" with "and it just began passing". I would also have the "play indefinitely" box ticked and it worked fine.

It now flashes all the time, even if I have the "play indefinitely" box clear.

Before updating to 6.2.5, I didn't this issue.

> Posted by CurseForge user theondry

I am unable to reproduce the behavior that you are describing. Please provide the export string of your entire profile - it is evident that this icon is part of a meta icon but I can't debug the issue unless I also have that meta icon and the other icons that are part of that meta icon.

I am a bit confused when you say that "When the buff is refreshed, this should stop" for an animation that you say you had set to play indefinitely for an icon that does not have any Icon: Stop Animation animations on it. An animation that is set to play indefinitely will not stop until the "Icon: Stop Animation" animation is played. If that is something that was happening previously, then it was a bug and it has been fixed.

So, to reiterate, in order to figure out what is going on here, I will need the export string of your entire profile.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I probably can't provide it exactly, as I've been tooling around with it since, but this is what I have now.

This is someone off-topic, but is it possible to have an animation play only while a given condition is true? (something along the lines of "while duration is less than 10s, flash") If this is already possible, I haven't figured out how to make it work, or haven't dug through the options enough.

> Posted by CurseForge user theondry

I am still unable to reproduce what you are describing (the animation playing longer than it is configured to do) with your profile. Is this still the issue?

Quote:

This is someone off-topic, but is it possible to have an animation play only while a given condition is true? (something along the lines of "while duration is less than 10s, flash") If this is already possible, I haven't figured out how to make it work, or haven't dug through the options enough.

No, this is not possible. Animations are not aware of what triggered them.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

No. I futzed with enough things and am playing with the animation triggers to try to bound the animation conditions.

I'm curious as to what makes animations finally stop. If I provide a trigger for an icon that goes indefinitely, and then the icon goes away, that animation will persist, even in the configuration.

This may be related to whatever ghost is made the original issue happen for me (that can't be reproduced).

As most everything I have has been fairly static since you released TMW back in... Wrath? I should probably do all these over again anyway.


> Posted by CurseForge user theondry

Animations that are set to play indefinitely will stop when the "Icon: Stop Animations" event is played or when you enter configuration mode.
